intro: Wikstroemia camelliifolia, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Thymelaeaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a waxy texture, while its flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of branches. Wikstroemia camelliifolia is well adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii and plays an important role in local ecosystems.
